workflowInfo.workflowDescription: Create a DB2 Type 2 JDBC provider and data source.

variable.name: SERVER_ID_NUM
variable.label: Server ID Number
variable.abstract: Three digit number identifying server instance (including leading zeroes)
variable.description: Three digit number identifying the provisioned server. This number is embedded in the server job name. For example, for server XX001, 001 is the Server ID Number.

variable.name: SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX
variable.label: SERVER_GROUP_PREFIX
variable.abstract: Two character prefix for all servers in group
variable.description: First two characters of the server job name (and cell name, user name, group name, ...)

variable.name: CONFIG_ROOT
variable.label: CONFIG_ROOT
variable.description: Each app server profile will be created in its own file system. This directory will contain mount points for each of those file systems.

variable.name: WORK_PATH
variable.label: WORK_PATH
variable.description: Path to contain the wsadmin script

variable.name: UID0_USER
variable.label: UID0_USER
variable.description: UID0_USER - Specifies id to be associated with workflow steps that run zpmt.sh and the batch jobs it creates.

variable.name: UID0_APPROVER
variable.label: UID0_APPROVER
variable.description: UID0_APPROVER - Specifies id to approve workflow steps that run zpmt.sh and the batch jobs it creates.

variable.name: DB2_REGISTRY_NAME
variable.label: DB2_REGISTRY_NAME
variable.description: Registry name of DB2 provision to bind to

variable.name: DB2_REGISTRY_ID
variable.label: DB2_REGISTRY_ID
variable.description: Registry id of DB2 provision to bind to

variable.name: DB2_LOCATION
variable.label: DB2_LOCATION
variable.description: Location of DB2 provision to bind to

variable.name: DB2_JDBC_DRIVER_PATH
variable.label: DB2_JDBC_DRIVER_PATH
variable.description: Path to the JDBC driver of DB2 provision to bind to

variable.name: DB2_HLQ
variable.label: DB2_HLQ
variable.description: The high level qualifier of the DB2 SDSNLOAD and SDSNLOD2 datasets

variable.name: DB2_USER_ID
variable.label: DB2_USER_ID
variable.description: User id to be used for authentication to DB2

variable.name: DB2_PASSWORD
variable.label: DB2_PASSWORD
variable.description: Password to be used for authentication to DB2

variable.name: DB2_HOST_NAME
variable.label: DB2_HOST_NAME
variable.description: Hostname of server where DB2 is located. This is used for type 4 connections.

variable.name: DB2_PORT_NUMBER
variable.label: DB2 DDF port number
variable.abstract: DDF port number on DB2 server

step.name: promptForID
step.title: Provide Server ID Number
step.instructions: Each provisioned WASt app server is identified by a unique 3 digit number. This number is used to make up the job name, cell name, and many other names related to the app server. This number must be provided to identify the app server on which the JDBC provider will be defined. In addition, the associated DB2 subsystem must already be defined in the z/OSMF registry. The DB2 registry name must be specified. Click FINISH to perform this step and create the JDBC provider and data source.

step.name: db2_getObjectID
step.title: Get DB2 object id
step.description: Invoke RESTful API to determine the object id of the registry entry.
step.instructions: Click Finish to perform the request to get the registry entry object id.

step.name: db2_getVariables
step.title: Get necessary DB2 data
step.description: Invoke RESTful API to fetch the variables in the registry entry.
step.instructions: Click Finish to perform the request to get the registry entry variable values.

step.name: createWsadminCommands
step.title: Build the wsadmin commands to create JDBC provider and data source
step.description: Use template to create wsadmin command file
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to create the wsadmin file from a template.

step.name: runWsadmin
step.title: Run wsadmin.sh to create the type 2 JDBC provider
step.description: Run wsadmin.sh to create the type 2 JDBC provider
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to create the Type 2 JDBC provider

step.name: cleanUp
step.title: Remove temp files
step.instructions: This step runs automatically to remove temporary files
